alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau; Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 10:17AM AKST until January 15 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LONG DURATION SNOW EVENT CONTINUING INTO THE NEW WORK WEEK... .As a system positions itself across the northern gulf, moisture is being steered into the Panhandle, with widespread precipitation enveloping the north and central areas. Warmer temperatures have penetrated inland, with many observation sites rising a few degrees by Monday afternoon. Expect snow ratios to continue drop as snow becomes wetter and heavier. As the front moves southeast Monday afternoon it will bring accumulating snowfall to the southern Panhandle. For the north, accumulating snowfall is expected to ramp up in the morning hours due to a slow moving frontal boundary. Along this front, as it moves south, expected the highest snowfall rates, upwards of 0.75 - 1.0 inches per hour. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel will may very difficult and is discouraged. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As temperatures continue to rise, snow will continue to become heavier through Monday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
